meanings.definition: Of or relating to the beak or snout of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The bird's rostral beak helped it catch fish easily.
meanings.sent2: The rostral shape of the dolphin's snout is perfect for swimming swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The rostral beak of the toucan made it look like it was always smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her rostral nose was so pointed, it could cut through the air like a knife.
meanings.sent5: The rostral beak of the pelican was long and curved, resembling a graceful arc.

meanings.definition: Situated near or toward the front of the body.
meanings.sent1: The rostral position of the heart makes it vulnerable to injury.
meanings.sent2: The rostral fins of the fish help it maneuver swiftly in the water.
meanings.sent3: The rostral location of the picnic spot made it easy to find.
meanings.sent4: Her rostral seat at the concert allowed her to see the stage clearly.
meanings.sent5: The rostral placement of the mailbox made it convenient for everyone in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the anterior part of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The rostral end of the ship was painted with colorful designs.
meanings.sent2: The rostral part of the building had intricate architectural details.
meanings.sent3: The rostral section of the cake was decorated with edible flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her rostral desk at work faced the window, providing a nice view.
meanings.sent5: The rostral edge of the cliff offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.
